questions.question_text: Where can a system administrator go if they are trying to determine why a user cannot log in to Salesforce? (Choose all that apply.)

discussion.content:
This question is rather outdated. I think the Login History is under Identity setup group now, instead of Manage Users.

It would be very helpful if a question can be tagged with latest exam time. Many of the settings have been changed and this causes a lot of confusion and wasted people's time to find out.

the question is "why" a user is not able to log in.
does login history tells him why? No i think. it tells about if he's able to login or not. but not tells why. it is tricky.

Selected Answer: AC
You can test it:
1- Setup > Users > user record > Login History
2- Setup > Setup > Login History
I would also go to profil, to check the Ip range and logging hours set for that particular profil
A There is no option Manage Users Login History
You can go to the user's profile setup > users > select user > scroll down to see login history. So why is C incorrect?

comments.content:
I believe that page is the User's page mentioned in A, which is accessed through the setup.
User's profile is the page that end users can see where the photo, user data, chatter and related groups, files, followers, etc. can be seen.

choices.A: The Login History related list on the user's record

discussion.content:
How are these answers generated?
I think the answer of AC is wrong.
Validation rules only apply when saving fields so A is incorrect.
Validation rules do not update field, so B is incorrect.
You can't leave the error message blank when setting up the validation rule so D is out of question.
Therefore the answer is C.

Selected Answer: AC
I think A and C are correct.
B isn't true because validation rules don't update anything.
D isn't true because an error message is required.

choices.C: Validation rules can reference fields which are not included in a page layout.
choices.A: Validation rules apply to all new and updated records for an object.
choices.B: Validation rules can update fields which are not included in a page layout.
choices.D: If an error message is not set, a default message will be prompted instead.

questions.question_text: Chatter Desktop is not available in which Salesforce Edition?
The account owner, opportunity owners, and case owners may or may not be the same user.

discussion.content: true: may or may not. Do not see another possible option ;)

Selected Answer: BC
Salesforce allows report exports in several formats, including CSV, Excel, and PDF.
Formatted reports can only be exported as .XLSX, while 'Details Only' reports can be exported by both options. Reference in initial comment.

choices.A: You can not export a report. You can only email it.
